intro: Pavetta baconia var. congolana, commonly known as the Congo pavetta, is a flowering plant native to central and western Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in cymes and bloom during the wet season. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
